nodes.bodyText:
@romani Does it make sense we trim down the IT run to just the specific check and not run the entire config?
One issue with the entire config is it may produce similar violations from different checks. IMO, that might be better to show.

nodes.bodyText: ci item is fixed to create this file in .ci-temp

CI failure

./.ci/travis/travis.sh: line 174: .ci-temp/output.log: No such file or directory
I am not seeing why this changed. Why is old file not needed anymore but new is.

it is still in use by it:
✔ ~/java/github/romani/checkstyle [6807-suppress-rightcurlyalone L|✔] 
$ ag "InputNoLineWrapGood" src/it/java
src/it/java/com/google/checkstyle/test/chapter3filestructure/rule332nolinewrap/NoLineWrapTest.java
57:        final String filePath = getPath("InputNoLineWrapGood.java");

I just create new file that is located in it, and not used by it but used by CI.
Ones we create new Check, this file become used by it and CI.
I'm not understanding. What is the purpose of this file / folder assignment if it can change and have no impact on CI? Why was old file needed before and not now?

it does affect CI.
you can change this file to any other Input and CI will fail, as it is very rare Input in our google ITs have some code and completely follow google style. So Input is specially selected.
Old file was used as it produce no violations, it is still good to be used in this CI item.
BUT I introduced new Input file that is not used in ITs at all, as it is for future Check, so I reused it in this CI item to be used at least by something and alarm us if somebody try to change suppression in wrong way.

very rare Input in our google ITs have some code and completely follow google style. So Input is specially selected.

Just a thought for another time, but why not keep the file the same and just build a super file that contains everything and not need to switch it from file to file.
